title: 111_hr5913
content: The "Text a Tip Act of 2010" establishes a pilot program for texting crime tips. The Attorney General can provide grants to law enforcement agencies for implementing an anonymous tip program using cell phone text messaging. The funds must be used for developing, expanding, or promoting the program, including expenses like salaries, training, technology, and public service promotion. The Federal share of a grant under this Act shall not exceed 75 percent of the program costs, including promotion and reward money. Grant amounts received should supplement non-Federal funds, not replace them. SEC. 3. PROGRAM REQUIREMENTS. A texting tip program of a State or local law enforcement agency eligible for a grant under this Act must comply with requirements such as administering the program, stripping incoming text messages of identifying information, ensuring the text tip is untraceable, not replacing existing hotlines, and providing sufficient training for law enforcement agency staff. The texting program for law enforcement agencies must not replace existing hotlines, train staff to respond to text tips, be compatible with mobile phone providers, include an unidentifiable code for follow-up information, and have an abort feature. The texting program for law enforcement agencies should not impose additional fees on tipsters' mobile phones. The program should be promoted to encourage citizen participation, especially among youth. SEC. 4. APPLICATIONS. To request a grant under this Act, a State or local law enforcement agency must submit an application to the Attorney General with required information. Each application must certify that the program meets Act requirements. SEC. 5. REPORTS AND EVALUATIONS. SEC. 5. REPORTS AND EVALUATIONS. Recipients of grants must submit yearly reports on activities' effectiveness to the Attorney General. The Attorney General will then report to the Senate and House Judiciary Committees. SEC. 6. DEFINITIONS. The term "texting tip program" allows citizens to anonymously text tips to aid law enforcement in preventing and solving crimes. "Texting" refers to sending written messages from a mobile phone. SEC. 7. AUTHORIZATION OF APPROPRIATIONS. SEC. 7. AUTHORIZATION OF APPROPRIATIONS. $5,000,000 authorized annually for fiscal years 2011-2016 for the Attorney General to implement the Act.
